translation.We are a small team of players dedicated: We are a small team of players dedicated to developing high-quality tools for mir4. Even costing us money for maintenance, development, and domain retention, we make it available for free. If you like our work and can support to keep us in thriving, any amount is welcome.
translation.You have to be logged in to do this: You have to be logged in to do this
translation.Enter your tickets and your XP earned pe: Enter your tickets and your XP earned per run to calculate the time taken to level up paired with peak/square runs.
translation.Enter your remaining vigor in hours to c: Enter your remaining vigor in hours to calculate your XP and percentage earned during an active vigor.
translation.Here you can add your owned items, eithe: Here you can add your owned items, either tradable or non-tradable and they will be counted for the total result of the recipe you are trying to calculate.
translation.That's the main item frame where you can: That's the main item frame where you can control the selected recipe.
translation.Here you can see the needed amount of it:
Here you can see the needed amount of items for the recipe you've selected. 

 Remember you can change the visibility settings of each rarity. 
 eg: Show only Legendary and Epic items.
translation.It shows the required amount of each ite:
It shows the required amount of each item and its rarity, you can hover with your mouse over an abstract number and reveal its specific value. 
 eg: 3k -> 3000. 
 
 Remember you can also show your tradable and non-tradable owned amount of that item by changing your settings.
translation.Here's where you can see the result of a:
Here's where you can see the result of a calculation, this can be affected by your inventory items or rarity items visibility settings. 

 Remember you can hover over abstract numbers to see their specific values
translation.This left panel shows the cost of items:
This left panel shows the cost of items with rarity, this can be a result of the necessary cost of base items for your recipe. 

 For example, this panel can account for the necessary items for crafting rare steel for a rare weapon.
translation.This right panel shows the generic items:
This right panel shows the generic items for recipe crafting, this is the sum of ALL item's cost of copper for example. 

 Note that this is going, to sum up the cost of base resources, secondary, tertiary, and so on.
translation.You can start a five minutes timer and s: You can start a five minutes timer and start measuring your performance, make sure to mark the start experience percentage and insert the final percentage when the times end up.
translation.Here you can use the measurement by perc: Here you can use the measurement by percentages which you need to use the timer, or you can use the second two inputs if you know your gain per minute.
translation.The use of the 5 minutes timer is requir: The use of the 5 minutes timer is required. Recommended if is the first time measuring your performance.
translation.Recommended for users who have already m: Recommended for users who have already measured experience gainings or if you already know the xp amount earned per minute.
translation.Insert your current and desired level, w:
Insert your current and desired level, when the necessary fields are correctly filled, you'll be able to see:

Remaining XP to the desired level. (accounts for your current percentage)
The amount of time needed to reach your desired level.
Your XP gains every 5 minutes.
